acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 72 hours EC50=2.5mg/L of the algae (Pseudokirchneriella subcapitata) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals (2004)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since LD50 value of the dermal administration test employing rats was >2,000 mg/kg (SIDS (2003)), it was classified into "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since it was a solid by the definition of GHS and inhalation in gas was not assumed, it was classified into "Not applicable".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: From a description of 625 mg/kg of lower value among LD50 value of 625 mg/kg and 800 mg/kg (SIDS (2003)) in the oral administration test employing rats, it was classified into Category 4.

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

carcinogenicity.rationale: Although it is 3B by German DFG classification (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), classification is not possible since no evaluation of other major international evaluation agencies such as IARC is made.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 2 and there were no rapid degradability (not readily degradable, the decomposition by BOD: 0% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data (1985)), it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: Although the nitro group is included in chemical structure and the calculation value of oxygen balance is -96, it was classified into Not classified since it was classified into Class 6.1 and PG II in the United Nations Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (UN No.1578(ICSC, 1995)).

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: From the description that the body cell in vivo mutagenicity test (chromosome aberration test employing a rat bone marrow cell (GLP)) which used the commercial grade (85% of this substance and 15% of 1,2-dichloro-3-nitrobenzene) is negative and there is no proof of in vivo heredity toxicity in the dosage which does not show general toxicity (SIDS (2003)), it was classified into "Not classified".

organic_peroxides.rationale: The organic compound not including peroxy group in molecule.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Although it is an organic compound including oxygen having chemically bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen, classification is not possible due to lack of data.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Even if it contacts the normal temperature air, it does not ignite spontaneously (ignition temperature 420degC (IUCLID,2000)).

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: There is a description in the 20 day oral administration study using rats (OECD TG 407) that no effect was caused against male and female reproductive functions (SIDS (2003)). Since it is described that ureteral dilatations were observed in fetuses at the dose level of 30mg/kg where suppression of the body weight increase is found among mother animals in the developmental toxicity study (GLP), while a product of commercial grade (85% of this substance and 155 of 1,2-dichloro-3- nitrobenzene) was orally administered to rats for 6-15 days of pregnancy, it was classified in Category 2. Incidentally, It is described that no clear effect was recognized on the reproduction by parent animals and development of fetal animals even with the administration of the maxumum dose level of 100mg/kg with regard to 1,2-dichloro-3- nitrobenzene (Access on October 2008).

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

self_heating_substances.rationale: The test method applicable for substances becoming liquid or gas at 140degC of test temperature has not been established.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Although the nitro is included in chemical structure, it was classified into Not classified, since it was classified into Class 6.1 and PG II in the United Nations Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (UN No.1578(ICSC, 1995)) .

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: From a description of "slightly irritating (the mean score values of corneal opacity / iritis / conjunctival redness / conjunctival edemas: 0/0.1/1.3/0.2) and it recovered in 72 hours" in the eye irritation/corrosion test (SIDS (2003)) employing rabbits (OECD TG 405, GLP), it was classified into "Not classified".

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since the 24 hour skin irritation/corrosion test with rabbits (OECD TG 404, GLP) did not identify skin irritation (average scored values for erythema/crust and edema:0.2, 0.0) (SIDS (2003)), it was classified into "Not classified".

skin_sensitizer.rationale: It was classified into "Not classified" from descriptions that skin sensitization was not shown in the Maximization tests employing 20 guinea pig (OECD TG 406, GLP) and that skin sensitization was not shown in the test of eczema-like contact dermatitis in ten women (SIDS (2003)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At) are not included.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system, liver, kidney)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (spleen)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In 4-month vapor inhalation exposure test in rats and mice (4 hours/day), increase in methemoglobin and Heinz body, decrease in the number of red blood cells and hemoglobin, and decrease in serum transaminase and liver catalase, etc. are described (SIDS (2003)). Moreover, it is written in 28-day oral administration test in rats (OECD TG 407, GLP) that there were increase in urea value, decrease in the number of red blood cells, drop in hematocrit, increase in relative liver weight, increase in MCV value, increase in reticulocyte, increase in lien weight, lien congestion, splenic extramedullary hematopoiesis, and hemosiderosis (SIDS (2003)). Since effects on the blood system, liver, kidney are found within the scope of the guidance value of Category 1, and effects on lien are found within the scope of the guidance value of Category 2, it was classified into Category 1 (blood system, liver, and kidney) and Category 2 (lien).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 (Narcotic effects) based on a description that inactivity, atrophy, and a coma were seen in the oral administration test of rats, and temporary inactivity is seen in dermal administration test of rabbits (SIDS (2003)).
